meanings.definition: The act of nominating or naming someone or something before the actual event or decision.
meanings.sent1: Her prenomination for the award surprised everyone at the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The prenomination of the team captain was a strategic move by the coach.
meanings.sent3: The prenomination of the class pet as the new school mascot caused a lot of excitement.
meanings.sent4: His prenomination as the next CEO raised eyebrows among the board members.
meanings.sent5: The prenomination of the movie for an Oscar made headlines in the entertainment industry.

meanings.definition: The act of prenominating or selecting a candidate for a position or award.
meanings.sent1: The prenomination of the top student for the scholarship was well-deserved.
meanings.sent2: Her prenomination as the lead actress in the play was a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent3: The prenomination of the youngest team member for captain sparked a debate among the players.
meanings.sent4: His prenomination for the prestigious award set a new standard in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The prenomination of the new employee for promotion impressed the entire team.
